data.title: Look up TV broadcast licensees
data.meta_description: Ofcom is responsible for licensing all UK commercial television services. This section contains information for licensees, including guidance notes and updates, as well as application forms and a list of current Ofcom TV broadcast licensees. This section highlights our current licensees
data.text:
The S4C service is provided by the S4C Authority. S4C's obligations are set out in broadcasting legislation rather than in a licence.

Ofcom's regulatory remit in respect of S4C includes duties to:

assess S4C's compliance with quotas agreed by the S4C Authority and Ofcom, including independent production, original production, news and current affairs;

monitor compliance and consider complaints relating to Ofcom codes, including the Broadcasting Code (which contains rules covering issues such as the protection of under eighteens, fairness and impartiality).

S4C’s public service remit, which is set by statute, is to provide a broad range of high quality and diverse programming with a substantial proportion of programmes in Welsh. The Secretary of State may review how effectively S4C’s public service remit is being fulfilled, in consultation with S4C Authority and the Welsh Government.

S4C
